Key Match Events: Luka Doncic had a heated argument with the match referee
A late controversial call left Doncic visibly frustrated
Doncic briefly grabbed his right ankle and was seen limping before heading to the bench during the timeout
Suns built an early 36-26 lead in the first quarter, sinking eight three-pointers, including two from center Jusuf Nurkic
Tyus Jones led all scorers with eight points in the opening minutes
Dallas came back in the third, tying the game at 65-65 at one point
Durant missed a three-pointer but Nurkic's rebound and slam put Phoenix up by two with 30 seconds remaining
A foul on Nurkic in the last seconds sent him to the line, and he made the second throw after missing the first free throw which secured a one-point win for Phoenix
Post-Match Reflections: Doncic's frustration was evident as he argued with officials after the game
As for Doncic's argument, there have not been any official reactions or any response from the 25-year-old as of writing the piece
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Suns secured the win with 114-113
Doncic's 30-point performance kept the Dallas Mavericks competitive despite an early 13-point deficit
